Things I've written about media

December 3, 2022

  • The week was fairly quiet: I’m still having trouble getting enough rest, which leads to headaches and dizzy spells, but with enough breaks, naps, and beauty sleep I seem to be on a path to feeling better.
  • I’m continuing to settle back into work, and I love working on my own design assignment. I can see how much I missed the tangible, practical design work, as well as design collaboration.
  • Don’t tell Anja, but I indulged in a new Filofax setup for 2023. I got my hands on both their Week on Two Pages Diary, and their One Day on a Page Diary, to give myself ample space to organize. I’m quite exicted to try the week pages, which have a monthly planner section as well.
  • I watched Girl In The Picture, and all I can say is: I have quite the stomach for gruesome stories, but this shook me.
  • I also watched 15 Minutes of Shame and I loved it, particularly the connection they made to medieval punishment. It made me think back to my time as a student, getting acquainted with medieval literature for the first time.
  • I had the 👏🏽 best 👏🏽 Chinese 👏🏽 food of my life, at Hoi Tin.

August 10, 2012

  • Essex Country by Jeff Lemire
  • Ergens Waar Je Niet Wil Zijn (Wrong Place) by Brecht Evens
  • Box Office Poison by Alex Robinson
  • Lucille by Ludivic Debeurme
  • Swallow Me Whole by Nate Powell
  • 120 Days of Simon by Simon Gärdenfors
  • Underwire by Jennifer Hayden
  • The Playwright by Daren White and Eddie Campbell
  • Any Empire by Nate Powell
  • Lost Dogs by Jeff Lemire
